Course Description: THIS COURSE IS DESIGNED TO ENABLE THE STUDENT TO UNDERSTAND AND APPLY THE FUNDAMENTAL CONCEPTS AND PROCEDURES OF BOTH FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL AC-COUNTING. TOPICS INCLUDE BASIC ACCOUNTING TERMINOLOGY, FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS AND INTERPRETATION, INTERNAL CONTROL, COST BEHAVIOR, COST-VOLUME-PROFIT ANALYSIS, BUDGETING, AND THE USE OF ACCOUNTING DATA IN MAKING INFORMED, ETH-ICAL DECISIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
OBJECTIVES:
INTRODUCE ACCOUNTING AS THE "LANGUAGE OF BUSINESS" AND TO TEACH STUDENTS TO APPLY ACCOUNTING THEORY, STANDARDS, PRINCIPLES AND PROCEDURES TO PRACTI-CAL ACCOUNTING PROBLEMS.
FAMILIARIZE STUDENTS WITH THE WAY ACCOUNTING INFORMATION NEEDED BY MANAG-ERS FOR PLANNING, CONTROL, & DECISION MAKING IS COLLECTED AND ASSEMBLED.
STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE EVIDENCE OF UNDERSTANDING BY COMPLETING A FINAL PAPER AND PRESENTATION BASED ON A CURRENT ARTICLE REGARDING A TOPIC WHICH WAS PRESENTED DURING THE COURSE.

LEARNING OUTCOMES:
IDENTIFY THE INFORMATION CONVEYED IN EACH OF THE FOUR BASIC FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE WAY THAT IT IS USED BY DIFFERENT DECISION MAKERS.

IDENTIFY WHAT CONSTITUTES A BUSINESS TRANSACTION AND APPLY TRANSACTION ANALYSIS TO RECORD THE EFFECTS OF THOSE TRANSACTIONS.

PREPARE BASIC FINANCIAL STATEMENTS BASED UPON GENER-ALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES.

DESCRIBE COMMON FINANCIAL STATEMENT RELATIONSHIPS USED IN FINANCIAL ANALYSIS.

PREPARE AN INCOME STATEMENT FOR A MANUFACTURING FIRM.

DETERMINE PRODUCT COSTS USING JOB-ORDER COSTING AND ACTIVITY-BASED COSTING.

TO WRITE ABOUT AND PRESENT A CONCEPT OF ACCOUNTING IN AN INFORMATIVE AND ENGAGING MANNER.
